primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does CIRREM land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race CIRREM? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. CIRREM scored 46 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: CIRREM. Roubaix, Illinois. 75 mi. Rolling Illinois farmland gravel with moderate climbing.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. The 100k distance produces finish times from Dillon McNeill's 3:06:38 record down to 6+ hour survivors. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. Starts and finishes at Cumming Tap, which immediately tells you this isn't some sanitized corporate event. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. The equipment list—"mountain bikes, cross bikes, ss's, fenders, fixies, fat bikes and even road bikes"—shows this crowd prioritizes showing up over showing off. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Registration includes 8AM breakfast, halfway checkpoint food, post-race lunch, and finishing at a tap house in Cumming, Iowa. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Plan for a few hundred all-in. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Registration opens 9pm November 27th and "will fill up in a few minutes" for 500 spots maximum. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Madison County's winding hills include bridges with "spaces between the boards that eat wheels for lunch—seriously, a friend separated his shoulder last weekend on it. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. Over 5000 feet of climbing across 63 miles through Madison County's rolling terrain.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Mild adventure. Scenic ride with a number plate. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Chicago 2 hours or Peoria 1 hour
Lodging: Roubaix has very limited lodging. Princeton or Peru have more options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Rural Illinois Farmland Gravel. If you're in Illinois and want a local rolling gravel event. yes, it's a solid regional race. If you're from out of state. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If CIRREM isn't quite right for you. For better Midwest events: Gravel Worlds, Almanzo 100, Dirty Kanza. For similar regional events: other Illinois gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
